Song.title: A Mighty Fortress Is Our God
Song.copyright: Words & Music by Martin Luther Public domain

Arrangement.text:
V1: [C] A mighty [G]fort[Em]ress [Am]is [D]our [G]God, [C]a [Em]bul[F]wark [C/E]ne[F]ver [Dm]fa[G]i[C]ling [C] Our helper [G]He [Em]a[Am]mid [D]the [G]flood, [C]of [Em]mor[F]tal [C/E]ills [F]pre[Dm]va[G]i[C]ling For [C]still our [Dsus]an[D]cient [G]foe, doth [C]seek to [F]work [E]us [Am]woe [E]His [Am]craft [Em]and [Dsus]pow'r [D]are [G]great, [F]and [F]armed [C]with [Dm7]cruel [E]hate [Am] On [Em]earth [F]is [C/E]not [F]his [Dm G]e[C]qual
V2: [C] Did we in [G]our [Em]own [Am]strength [D]con[G]fide, [C]our [Em]stri[F]ving [C/E]would [F]be [Dm]lo[G]-[C]sing [C] Were not the [G]right [Em]man [Am]on [D]our [G]side, [C]the [Em]man [F]of [C/E]God's [F]own [Dm]cho[G]o[C]sing You [C]ask who [Dsus]that [D]may [G]be,{,} Christ [C]Jesus, [F]it [E]is [Am]He [E]The [Am]Lord [Em]of [Dsus]Hosts [D]His [G]name, [F]from [F]age [C]to [Dm7]age the [E]same [Am] And [Em]He [F]must [C/E]win [F]the [Dm G]ba[C]ttle
V3: [C] And though this [G]world, [Em]with [Am]dev[D]ils [G]filled, [C]should [Em]threa[F]ten [C/E]to [F]un[Dm]do[G] [C]us [C] We will not [G]fear, [Em]for [Am]God [D]hath [G]willed, [C]His [Em]truth [F]to [C/E]tri[F]umph [Dm]thro[G]ugh [C]us The [C]prince of [Dsus]dark[D]ness [G]grim, we [C]tremble [F]not [E]for [Am]him [E]His [Am]rage [Em]we [Dsus]can [D]en[G]dure,{,} [F]for [F]lo! [C]His [Dm7]doom is [E]sure [Am] One [Em]lit[F]tle [C/E]word [F]shall [Dm]fe[G]ll [C]him
V4: [C] That Word a[G]bove [Em]all [Am]earth[D]ly [G]powers, [C]no [Em]thanks [F]to [C/E]them [F]a-b[Dm G]i[C]deth [C] The Spirit [G]and [Em]the [Am]gifts [D]are [G]ours, [C]through [Em]Him [F]who [C/E]with [F]us [Dm]s[G]i[C]deth Let [C]goods and [Dsus]kin[D]dred [G]go,{,} this [C]mortal [F]life [E]als[Am]o [E]The [Am]bo[Em]dy [Dsus]they [D]may [G]kill,{,} [F]God's [F]truth [C]a[Dm7]bideth [E]still [Am] His [Em]king[F]dom [C/E]is [F]for[Dm G]e[C]ver
Arrangement.searchtext: v1 a mighty fortress is our god a bulwark never failing our helper he amid the flood of mortal ills prevailing for still our ancient foe doth seek to work us woe his craft and powr are great and armed with cruel hate on earth is not his equal v2 did we in our own strength confide our striving would be losing were not the right man on our side the man of gods own choosing you ask who that may be christ jesus it is he the lord of hosts his name from age to age the same and he must win the battle v3 and though this world with devils filled should threaten to undo us we will not fear for god hath willed his truth to triumph through us the prince of darkness grim we tremble not for him his rage we can endure for lo his doom is sure one little word shall fell him v4 that word above all earthly powers no thanks to them abideth the spirit and the gifts are ours through him who with us sideth let goods and kindred go this mortal life also the body they may kill gods truth abideth still his kingdom is forever

Arrangement.text:
V1: [C] A mighty [G]fortress [Am]is our [G]God, a [Em]bulwark [C]never [Dm]fai[C]ling [C] Our helper [G]He a[Am]mid the [G]flood, of [Em]mortal [C]ills pre[Dm]vai[C]ling For [C]still our [Dsus]an[D]cient [G]foe, doth [C]seek to [F]work [E]us [Am]woe His [Am]craft and [Dsus]pow'r are [G]great, and [F]armed with [Dm7]cruel [E]hate On [Em]earth is [C]not his [Dm]e[C]qual
V2: [C] Did we in [G]our own [Am]strength con[G]fide, our [Em]striving [C]would be [Dm]lo-[C]sing [C] Were not the [G]right man [Am]on our [G]side, the [Em]man of [C]God's own [Dm]choo[C]sing You [C]ask who [Dsus]that [D]may [G]be,{,} Christ [C]Jesus, [F]it [E]is [Am]He The [Am]Lord of [Dsus]Hosts His [G]name, from [F]age to [Dm7]age the [E]same And [Em]He must [C]win the [Dm]ba[C]ttle
V3: [C] And though this [G]world, with [Am]devils [G]filled, should [Em]threaten [C]to un[Dm]do [C]us [C] We will not [G]fear, for [Am]God hath [G]willed, His [Em]truth to [C]triumph [Dm]through [C]us The [C]prince of [Dsus]dark[D]ness [G]grim, we [C]tremble [F]not [E]for [Am]him His [Am]rage we [Dsus]can en[G]dure,{,} for [F]lo! His [Dm7]doom is [E]sure One [Em]little [C]word shall [Dm]fell [C]him [A]
{key:D} V4: [D] That Word a[A]bove all [Bm]earthly [A]powers, no [F#m]thanks to [D]them a-b[Em]i[D]deth [D] The Spirit [A]and the [Bm]gifts are [A]ours, through [F#m]Him who [D]with us [Em]si[D]deth Let [D]goods and [Esus]kin[E]dred [A]go,{,} this [D]mortal [G]life [F#]als[Bm]o The [Bm]body [Esus]they may [A]kill,{,} God's [G]truth a[Em7]bideth [F#]still His [F#m]kingdom [D]is for[Em]e[D]ver
Arrangement.searchtext: v1 a mighty fortress is our god a bulwark never failing our helper he amid the flood of mortal ills prevailing for still our ancient foe doth seek to work us woe his craft and powr are great and armed with cruel hate on earth is not his equal v2 did we in our own strength confide our striving would be losing were not the right man on our side the man of gods own choosing you ask who that may be christ jesus it is he the lord of hosts his name from age to age the same and he must win the battle v3 and though this world with devils filled should threaten to undo us we will not fear for god hath willed his truth to triumph through us the prince of darkness grim we tremble not for him his rage we can endure for lo his doom is sure one little word shall fell him v4 that word above all earthly powers no thanks to them abideth the spirit and the gifts are ours through him who with us sideth let goods and kindred go this mortal life also the body they may kill gods truth abideth still his kingdom is forever
